Key Findings: PERC and TOPCon cells exhibit nearly identical BOL and EOL performance with high doping levels.  Lower doping levels in TOPCon show improved BOL efficiency, but this does not translate to superior EOL efficiency due to radiation-induced defects and dopant compensation.

Title: The Effect of Water Vapor and Humidity on the Topcon Photovoltaic Cell
Key Findings: Poor weathering and high humidity have a negative impact on photovoltaic cells' and panels' performance. Moisture intrusion is at the center of most degradation mechanisms that lead to PV module power degradation.

Title: N-TOPCON
Key Findings: Acid polishing preserves the round pyramid structure but removes the sharp pyramid tips, improving contact passivation while ensuring good metal contact. It can better balance the contradiction between passivation characteristics (J0 ~ 4.73fA/cm2, J0, metal ~ 67.26fA/cm2, iVoc ~ 740 mV) and contact characteristics ( ρc, B ~ 1.67m Ω cm2), and achieve the highest average cell efficiency (24.05%).
